intro: Stipa caucasica var. desertorum, commonly known as the desert needlegrass, is a perennial grass species native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and dense, spike-like inflorescences that produce small, narrow spikelets. The plant is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that allow it to thrive in poor soils and low moisture conditions. Its foliage is typically gray-green, with a rough, hairy texture that helps reduce water loss. This grass plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for grazing animals in its native habitat.
